main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects reported along the East Coast of the United States on December 13-14, 1958.
interesting points: Several aircraft pilots reported seeing bright, glowing objects at high altitudes over the Atlantic Ocean and along the coastline.
The objects were observed moving at very high speeds, making sharp turns, and disappearing suddenly.
Ground-based witnesses in multiple states, including Connecticut, New Jersey, and New York, also reported seeing similar objects.
Radar operators were unable to track the objects on their screens.
The sightings occurred over a wide geographical area and spanned several hours on two consecutive days.
sighted object: bright, glowing orbs and other unidentified flying objects
location: East Coast of the United States, including Connecticut, New York, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and Ohio
witnesses: aircraft pilots, ground-based observers, and radar operators
